content: Hi, I'd like to install Zulip in production but I already have a settings.py file created ahead of time. Is there a good way to install without requiring the --hostname and --email options, since I already have those configured in settings.py? (I'm trying to automate this process, so it's easier if I don't have to parse them back out.)
You can install with --no-init-db, then copy settings.py into place and run the two commands it tells you to run at the bottom of the install script.
We possibly should add that approach more explicitly to the main installer documentation.
Oh, hi Anders, I didn't realize you worked on Zulip! Thanks for the answer :)
